review_title: My experience rewarding  and I was very supported in my role
job_title: Head of Digital Marketing & Courses in London, England
pros: I had a great time working at 360 GSP as the head of digital marketing and courses. I was given a lot of autonomy in my role and my opinion was always listened to and valued. My manager Simon was always very  supportive and the company owner Sher is ambitious, passionate and approachable. It was a very rewarding role and I’ll never forget how brilliant it was to see passionate students achieve their career goals.
cons: My experience working for the organisation was very positive.

review_title: Very respectable company to work for
pros: I have been working at 360 GSP for 1 year and 5 months. It has been a great opportunity to work with individuals who share the same passion to help people out in getting into either IT or Digital Marketing. Being in a sales environment where the management are supportive and want you to succeed and hit targets is amazing. There has been times through my time here where I have needed advice and a inspiration to keep myself going on as I have had a lot of personal things going on. The team being such a close team I was able to go to the directors and explain my situation and they were able to help the best way they can. We were always rewarded for the hard work that was put in. Management have always asked for ideas from staff which were implemented to make the sales cycle more smooth.
cons: Took much longer to progress in to a senior role than I expected.

review_title: A great place to develop your career
job_title: Digital Marketing Executive in London, England
pros: I initially joined 360 GSP with only limited digital marketing experience. However I was immediately trusted by senior staff members to work independently as well as a part of a team, exposing me to a wide range of marketing channels and tools. In general,  360 GSP provided me with the perfect platform to develop my skills and gain hands-on digital marketing experience.  I met some great people and am grateful for the opportunities I was given throughout my time there.
cons: Working in a fast-paced environment as part of a small team meant that it could sometimes be difficult to stay on top of my task list in order to help meet ever-changing business needs.  At times it would have been helpful if priorities were agreed upon and communicated explicitly throughout the company.
